column4: Anyone else having their flash video in an unwanted fast-forward mode in every website ?
Hmm. Nope, Try reinstalling the flash-plugin
let me try that..
is the package's name flashplugin-downloader ?
Yes :), try "sudo apt-get purge flashplugin-downloader && sudo apt-get install flashplugin-downloader"
I did that and restarted the browser, but no success... Maybe I should try Flash-Aid (the firefox extension) ?
also, I noted it was installing flashplugin-downloader:i386.... and it should be installing the amd64 or 64bit version I think...
Hmm, did you try right clicking on some flash content and making sure that the "fast-forward" option isnt checked?
oh I'm sorry I didn't even know there was a fast-forward option... I'll check for that..
Nevermind aha, there isn't. I'm thinking back to 5-10 years ago when shockwave was still used.
oh... well I tried the Flash-Aid options and none of the options seem to work with me (either the beta version from adobe or the stable version from the repositories...)
in the flash website it says the global settings of flash in Linux/Gnome systems are in System > Preferences > Adobe Flash Player... but I can't find that... do you know where they are ?
No, I can't either. Hmm
Try going into Sound preferaces and disabling hdmi, also try flash-aid
already done that...
Dang.. I really don't know

funny thing, after trying both the 32bit stable version from the repositories and the 64bit unstable version from Adobe Labs (through Flash-Aid), the videos on Firefox are now slow with some lags all the time, despite all the video loads ok... On chrome it's still in the weird fast forward mode.
Weird. I'm on 64-bit 12.04 gnome-shell and mine fine
same here... This started yesterday I don't know if it was because of some update or not but if you're ok then it's not a bug...
very weird: I purged everything related to flash, and now Chrome works fine but Firefox says there's an add-on missing... Does this mean Chrome has it's own bundled version of flash ?
Yes, it does. Google chrome even has its own bundles libraries
ohh... amazing...
